Package net.xqhs.util.logging

Class LogWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.util.logging.LogWrapper
  • public abstract class LogWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
    Use this abstract class to implement any [wrapper of a] logging structure used in a Unit.

    All types of wrappers available in the project should be stated in LogWrapper.LoggerType.

    This class implements a basic management of name, level, highlighting, and also outputs and their associated OutputStreams. If the output is a StringLogOutput, a ByteArrayOutputStream will be created; if the output is a StreamLogOutput, the stream must be managed by the StreamLogOutput instance.

    Extending this class requires at least implementing the l(Level, String) method.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel​(Logger.Level level)
        Sets the level of the underlying log to a level that corresponds to the given instance of Logger.Level, according to the implementation.
        Parameters:
        level - - the desired log level.

      • setHighlighted

        public void setHighlighted​(boolean isHighlighted)
        Set whether the log is highlighted.
        Parameters:
        isHighlighted - - true if highlighted, false otherwise.

      • addOutput

        public void addOutput​(net.xqhs.util.logging.output.LogOutput logOutput)
        Adds a log destination, as defined by a LogOutput instance. If the logOutput is an instance of StreamLogOutput, the stream specified by the logOutput will be used; otherwise, a new ByteArrayOutputStream is created.
        Parameters:
        logOutput - - a log output.

      • removeOutput

        public void removeOutput​(net.xqhs.util.logging.output.LogOutput logOutput)
        Remove a log destination.
        Parameters:
        logOutput - - the output to remove.

      • removeAllOutputs

        public void removeAllOutputs()
        Removes all outputs used by the log.

      • l

        public abstract void l​(Logger.Level level,
                       java.lang.String message)
        The logging function to override in the implementation of the class.
        Parameters:
        level - - the Logger.Level of the message, that will be translated to an equivalent level of the underlying log.
        message - - the logging message.

      • exit

        public void exit()
        Instructs the underlying infrastructure to clear any information and actions related to this log.
